Description: Round flat clay disc probably used as spindle-whorl, made of fine brown Nile clay that was consolidated after excavation leading to a darker colouration. The disc has rounded edges and is pieced in the middle with a diameter of 0.6-0.4 cm. Slightly distorted in shape, getting thinner towards one side.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E12.X, west of town wall, surface B.2
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 236)
